definitions.definition: a game in which two or four players use rackets to hit a ball backwards and forwards across a net on a specially marked court

examples.text: I met a friend for a quick game of tennis after work.
She is a popular figure on the international tennis circuit.
He retired from competitive tennis at the age of 34.

wordOrigin: late Middle English tenetz, tenes ‘real tennis’, apparently from Old French tenez ‘take, receive’ (called by the server to an opponent), imperative of tenir.
